bioghist.p: Albert S. Matlack is an adjunct professor of Chemistry at the University of Delaware and was for many years a research chemist at Hercules Inc. Matlack is a passionate conservationist and an advocate of "green chemistry," which aims to reduce the use of toxic chemicals, to produce less waste, and to use less energy in industry. He is the author of "Introduction to Green Chemistry," and he also lectures on this subject in his classes at the University of Delaware. He is the president of the Society of Natural History of Delaware, in which role he leads monthly educational field trips.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Albert S. Matlack. Materials in the collection include: technical reports, newsletters, notes, and programs related to environmental and conservation issues in Delaware, such as air quality, wetlands, farmland preservation, and native plants. The collection also contains pamphlets, booklets, newsletters, journals, and correspondence related to Tower Hill School, Delaware, Delmarva Power, the Delmarva Ornithological Society, the Experiment in International Living, University of Delaware, the International Meditation Society, and the Jewish Community Center.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
